solution_line_template: If the electricity bill costs ${electricity_bill_cost}, and Cheryl spends ${extra_cell_phone_cost} more on her monthly cell phone expenses than on the electricity bill, she pays ${electricity_bill_cost}+${extra_cell_phone_cost} = $<<{electricity_bill_cost}+{extra_cell_phone_cost}={cell_phone_expenses}>>{cell_phone_expenses} on cell phone expenses.

Since the cost to enter the tournament is {tournament_percentage_increase}*{cell_phone_expenses} = $<<{tournament_percentage_increase}*{cell_phone_expenses}={additional_tournament_cost}>>{additional_tournament_cost} more than her monthly cell phone expenses.

The total cost of joining the golf tournament is ${cell_phone_expenses}+${additional_tournament_cost} = $<<{cell_phone_expenses}+{additional_tournament_cost}={total_tournament_cost}>>{total_tournament_cost}
